title: Feat/pals
body:
## Description

Changes:
- Introduced PalsScreen with support for creating and managing AI assistants and roleplay characters
- Added new components for Pals creation: AssistantPalSheet, RoleplayPalSheet, ModelSelector, FormField
- Implemented PalStore for managing Pals data with persistence
- Added new icons and updated existing components to support Pals functionality
- Integrated Pals into navigation and sidebar
- Updated theme and styling to support new Pals-related UI elements

Fixes #150 
Fixes #214 (Llama.rn upgrade to 0.5.3-1)
Fixes #152 (Llama.rn upgrade to 0.5.3-1)

## Platform Affected

- [x] iOS
- [x] Android

## Checklist

- [x] Necessary comments have been made.
- [x] I have tested this change on:
  - [x] iOS Simulator/Device
  - [x] Android Emulator/Device
- [x] Unit tests and integration tests pass locally.
author: Mukhammadali

comments.body:
- [x] Test fails due to: `Jest: "global" coverage threshold for branches (60%) not met: 57.3%`
- [x] We need to add 'delete' functionality for  Pals.
- [x] [Bug] Edit pals ‚Äì previous values do not persist when navigating away and returning to the Pals screen.
- [x] Roleplay prompt generator doesn't use models stop words
- [x] Add chevron to model selectors
- [x] Add text to the model selector indicating which models are best for prompt generation.
- [x] When there are many palls or downloaded models the sheet doesn't scroll up enough. 
- [x] Add stop for ai prompt generator. 
- [x] By selecting an active pal (or an explicit button for deactivation of a pal) it should deselect the pal. 
- [x] When a pal is selected, a new chat should continue using the same pal.
- [x] [Bug] When no model has been downloaded, the empty chat page's "Download Model" button opens the Pals/Models sheet instead of directing to the Models page.
- [x] For the Pals object, we need to store the default model's basic information, including its name, oid, size, number of params, hf download url etc, so that we can use these info to display the default model yet notify the user when the model is not downloaded, and allow the user to download the model. The download process should be handled safely as it is done in the model page, ie checking storage space and monitoring for memory warnings, etc.
- [x] Add warning icon on pals card that the default model is not downloaded.

title: [Feat]: Expose local openai compatible http api
body:
**Description**
I want to use openai library to talk to local models hosted in pocketpal. Is it possible to start pocketpal as a daemon similar to ollama?

**Use Case**
Allow offline on device llm calling from other apps
author: btwiuse

comments.body:
+1

This would be a nice use case.

Just to clarify, you want your phone to act as a server? Why not use Ollama, Llama.cpp, etc.? and how would you like to connect to this phone? from another phone? can you please elaborate regarding the use case?

> Just to clarify, you want your phone to act as a server?

Yes

> Why not use Ollama, Llama.cpp, etc.?

That would require users to setup termux and install (compile from source) the said apps since they are not available as standard Android apps, furthermore why use another llm backend for the server if it can all be done in one app. And since llama.rn is built on llama.cpp, I think it should have a built in server.

> and how would you like to connect to this phone? from another phone?

From other apps on the same phone along with an option to expose it to other devices on the network would be nice.

> can you please elaborate regarding the use case?

To use as a backend for other apps/services, such as a GPT powered keyboard, or for developers to build around and experiment with the API using their own apps.

@btwiuse @WaelShaikh thanks for the suggestion and the clarification! After looking into this, I'd say this feature is outside the scope of the app, and the effort needed to implement and maintain it is too high. So, I won‚Äôt be moving forward with it atm.

Closing this issue now, but we may revisit things like this in the feature!

title: [Feat]: When searching for hugging face model, include the user in the name of the model
body:
**Description**
When searching, you can include the publisher. I.e. when searching for llama 3.1 you could search "meta-llama/Meta-Llama-3-8B" instead of just "Meta-Llama-3-8B"

**Use Case**
So you can search by publisher. Currently it will show models by other random people.
author: ChristopherKing42

comments.body: Can you please share the Hugging Face link you can‚Äôt find in the app search? As far as I recall, Meta has not published GGUFs version.

Oh I think I misunderstood! It actually does work like I want.

I thought the search was ignoring the author, I didn't realize that there just aren't any meta models.

title: [Feat]: Keep Screen On to enable longer/slower generations
body:
Problem:
Often, the screen turns off during long-running generative processes, interrupting the generation and potentially losing valuable results. This is particularly frustrating when generating large text responses.

Solution:
Implement a feature that keeps the screen on while a generative process is active. This could be a toggle in the app's settings.

Use Case:
 * Long text generation: When writing long articles, essays, or creative writing, the screen turning off can disrupt the flow and lead to lost ideas.
 * Code generation: Writing complex code or running long-running scripts can benefit from a persistent screen to avoid interruptions and easily view output.
Additional Considerations:
 * Battery: This feature may impact battery life. Consider providing an option to turn off the feature after a certain period of inactivity.
 * Wake lock: Use the Android WakeLock API to prevent the screen from turning off.
author: Duxon

comments.body:
Thanks this makes sense to me. 

I am thinking this: keeping the screen awake during inference and deactivating it when no inference is taking place.

 Are there any other cases I should consider?
This is closed, and should be available as part of next release.

title: [Feat]: Add checksum for Fastlane files
body:
**Description**
For safety, it is important to have (Sha-256) checksums. 

**Use Case**
Better security, verify authenticity.
author: I-I-IT

comments.body: I assume the checksum is needed for gradle?

> I assume the checksum is needed for gradle?

Yup

title: chore: add Fastlane metadata folder for F-Droid

F-Droid expects metadata folder inside the root Fastlane directory. This PR adds metadata folder with relevant files. 

Partially Fixes #55

title: [Bug]: App crashes when selecting Advanced settings for models.
body:
The app crashes when selecting advanced options for models after the lastest update of 1.4.4
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to models
2. Click on any model
3. Click on advanced settings 
4. App crashes 

**Expected behavior**
Just crashes 



**Environment (please complete the following information):**
- Device: Nothing Phone 2
- OS: Android 14
- App Version: 1.4.4
author: Bestello

comments.body: Hey, thanks for reporting this! #77 will address this bug. In the meantime, you can resolve it by resetting the model list (using the `Reset Models` FAB button on the **models** page).

title: [ux] Disable auto-scroll after scrolling "up" while model is generating an answer
body:
ChatGPT and similar apps automatically disable scrolling after scrolling upwards while the model is generating output.
Currently I can't start reading the response until it's fully generated because output is scrolling automatically. In other apps scrolling to the top stops the automatic scrolling which seems like a good solution.
author: thradya

comments.body: To add to this, on Android the auto scroll is quite jarring even though my phone has 120Hz refresh rate. Could the scrolling be smoothed along with the above?
